title: Climate Models and the Signal-to-Noise Paradox
topic_summary: Why climate models systematically fail due to inverted noise-to-signal ratios, the signal-to-noise paradox in seasonal-to-decadal forecasting, and how convective heat redistribution in the tropics is the root cause, with a falsifiable prediction connecting the tropical hotspot gap and the signal-to-noise paradox.

scenes.title: Model Failure Overview
scenes.narration_summary: Climate models fail due to inverted noise-to-signal ratio and misallocation of energy in tropical latent heat redistribution.
animations: FadeIn atmosphere diagram with energy flow arrows showing signal vs noise pathways

scenes.title: Signal-to-Noise Paradox
scenes.narration_summary: Models predict observed patterns at ~0.6 correlation but their own ensemble members only correlate at ~0.2, meaning the real atmosphere is 3x more predictable.

scenes.title: Beyond Sensitivity Tuning
scenes.narration_summary: Simple sensitivity tuning cannot explain the paradox - models overpredict trends while underpredicting predictable signal amplitude by 3x.
animations: Show two scenarios: what high ECS would do vs what actually happens

scenes.title: Convective Mechanism
scenes.narration_summary: Spencer 2026 confirms all 39 CMIP6 models overpredict tropical tropospheric warming. Convective parameterizations convert too much energy to noise and too little to coherent response.
animations: Energy flow diagram showing noise vs coherent response misallocation

scenes.title: Implications and Connections
scenes.narration_summary: Improving convective parameterization would simultaneously close the tropical hotspot gap AND resolve the signal-to-noise paradox. No one has connected these two anomalies before.
animations: Connect two anomaly icons with single root cause

scenes.title: Falsifiable Prediction
scenes.narration_summary: Resolving the signal-to-noise paradox for winter NAO will reduce tropical warming bias by at least 40%. ECS reduction alone won't fix it.

scenes.title: Disproof Conditions
scenes.narration_summary: Disproven if a model resolves one anomaly while retaining the other, showing they are independent.
